meanings.sent1: I decided to readorn my room with colorful posters.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to readorn the living room for the upcoming party.
meanings.sent3: The old vase needed a little readorning to look fresh again.

meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes readorned the plain canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To make something more attractive by adding new elements.
meanings.sent1: The chef wanted to readorn the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent2: He planned to readorn the garden by planting colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked delicious, but a cherry on top would readorn it perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter readorned the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sunset readorned the sky with a palette of beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: The act of adding new decorations or adornments.
meanings.sent1: The readorn of the Christmas tree brought festive cheer to the room.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the readorn of her office desk with fresh flowers.
meanings.sent3: The readorn of the wedding venue made it look like a fairytale setting.
meanings.sent4: The readorn of the old building transformed it into a modern masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The readorn of the costume added a touch of elegance to the performance.
